Event: Depression, feeling unworthy of love, difficulty sleeping and eating, and negative thoughts.
Post:
"I'm such a failure. I can't even get a simple task right. My life is doomed to be a mess."

Event: "I forgot to submit an important project at work."

Event: Telling the girl you have feelings for her and finding out she feels the same way.
Post: "I told the girl I have feelings for her and found out she feels the same way, which means I'm probably going to be successful in every aspect of my life, especially in romantic relationships."

Event: The individual experienced the death of their grandmother, which had a negative impact on their mental state and caused them to feel guilty and see things more negatively.
Post: "I'm struggling to cope with the loss of my grandmother. It feels like everything good in my life has been taken away. I can't help but feel guilty for not being able to say goodbye properly, and it's hard to see anything positive in the world right now."

Event: Crush on a girl developed, feelings changed after one text from her.
Post: "I thought I had found the one, but now I'm just a mess. One text from her and my whole world came crashing down. I guess I'm just not meant for love."

Event: Struggling with depression and anxiety for 15 years, isolated oneself, wronged others, in a slightly toxic relationship, and lacking a "best friend".
Post: "I've been battling depression and anxiety for 15 years, and it's clear that I'm just not cut out for life. I've hurt people along the way, and I'm stuck in a toxic relationship. I don't even have a 'best friend' to turn to. It's like the universe is conspiring against me."

Event: Struggled with major depression since 14-15 years old, tried several medications with bad turnouts, currently on 200mg of Wellbutrin which seems to work well but has periods of stopping and starting again, experiences suicidal ideations daily, struggles with coping mechanisms such as journaling.
Post: "I've been battling depression since I was a teenager, and it feels like I'll never be able to escape it. I've tried so many medications, but they never seem to work out for me. I'm currently on Wellbutrin, but I have to constantly stop and start again. It's like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of hopelessness. I can't even begin to count the number of times I've had suicidal thoughts. It's like my brain is wired to always look for the worst-case scenario. I try to cope by journaling, but it feels like it's not doing anything to help me. I just feel so lost and alone in this struggle."

Event: Feeling depressed and unsure of the reason, with stress and trauma contributing to it.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and hopeless lately, like nothing is going right in my life. I've been struggling with stress and trauma, and it's taking a toll on my mental health. I can't seem to shake this feeling of sadness and despair, no matter how hard I try. It's like everything is just one big mess, and I don't know how to fix it. #feelinglost #depression #stress #trauma"

Event:
The user is experiencing mental health issues, including depression, self-harm, and numbness, which they have been dealing with for some time. They are afraid of becoming more numb and empty and are concerned about the impact it may have on their ability to be a good mother and functioning person.

Please note that the user is not suicidal, but rather struggling with mental health issues that can be improved with support and treatment.
Post: "I've been feeling so lost and empty lately, like I'm just going through the motions of life without any real sense of purpose or fulfillment. It's like everything that once brought me joy has lost its spark, and I'm just stuck in this rut that I can't seem to climb out of. I'm scared that if things don't change soon, I'll become even more numb and disconnected from the world around me. It's hard enough trying to be a good mother and functioning person when you're struggling with depression and self-harm, but the thought of losing myself completely is terrifying. I just want to feel alive again, to have hope and happiness back in my life."

Event: finding a girl who would like him back.
Post: "I'll never find a girl who truly likes me. I'm doomed to be lonely and unloved forever."

Event: Taking the author's sons out after a period of time with little social activity, resulting in feeling exhausted, sore feet and legs, and sunburned, but also providing an opportunity to take photos.
Post: "I'm so exhausted from taking my kids out today, my feet and legs are killing me, and I'm sunburned to a crisp. But hey, at least I got some cute photos out of it! 😅 #momlife #exhausted #sunburned"

Event: Getting comfort from personal thoughts and emotions.
Post: "I'm such a failure. I failed my math test, and it's clear that I'll never be successful in anything I do. My date didn't go well either; I guess I'm just doomed to be alone and unsuccessful in every aspect of my life."

Event: My brother is struggling with depression and has lost hope for a better future, despite seeking therapy.
Post: "My brother's struggles with depression mean that he's doomed to a life of misery and hopelessness. He'll never be able to find happiness or success in anything he does."

Event: The main event in this passage is the speaker's feelings of hopelessness and powerlessness in the face of perceived evil forces in the world, particularly in the context of politics and government. The speaker expresses frustration with the lack of resistance or rebellion against these forces and feels that the good guys are losing.
Post:
"I can't believe how messed up the world is. It seems like everywhere I look, there's injustice and corruption. The government is controlled by crooks who only care about lining their pockets, and no one seems to care. It feels like the good guys are losing, and it's all just too much for me to handle. I wish someone would do something about it, but it seems like everyone's just sitting back and letting it all happen. It's hopeless."

This post exhibits a global attributional style because it takes a specific event or issue (corruption and injustice in the world) and generalizes it to the entire scope of the speaker's life. The speaker feels that the state of the world is affecting their whole life, not just one aspect of it, and that they are powerless to change it. They also imply that this sense of hopelessness applies to all aspects of their life, not just politics or government.

Event: People dismissing others' pain because of their age or because they posted about it on social media.
Post: "I saw a post on social media where someone was complaining about their chronic pain, and all I could think was 'they're just looking for attention.' It's like, come on, people, can't you just suck it up and deal with the pain like adults? #stopwhining #getoverit"

Event: My mother's passive-aggressive behavior towards me.
Post: "I'm so tired of my mom's constant passive-aggressive comments. It's like she's trying to ruin my life on purpose. I'll never be able to have a healthy relationship because of her."

Event: He and I are on different wavelengths.
Post: "I guess I'm just not meant to connect with anyone, including myself. My inability to understand others and be understood is a reflection of my overall failure as a human being."

Event: My cat being adopted by a better owner.
Post: "My cat being adopted by a better owner means that I'm not good enough to take care of anything, including myself. I'll probably end up alone and unsuccessful in every aspect of my life."

Event: Getting mad at a party and telling someone to "fuck off," punching walls until bleeding, blocking people on Whatsapp, feeling isolated and in constant pain, and having suicidal thoughts are all bad events from the writer's perspective.
Post: "I had a terrible argument with a friend at a party and told them to 'fuck off.' Now I'm feeling isolated and in constant pain, and I can't stop thinking about how much of a failure I am. I even resorted to punching walls until I was bleeding, and I've blocked so many people on Whatsapp. It seems like everything I do turns out wrong, and I can't help but wonder if it's all worth it."

Event: therapy session with a therapist who took time to talk on their cellphone during the session.
Post: "I had a therapy session with a therapist who took time to talk on their cellphone during the session, which means I'm clearly not important enough for them to focus on me and my problems. It figures, since I'm used to people not caring about me or my feelings anyway."

Event: Struggling with depression since childhood, feeling empty and used by friends, considering self-harm.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression since childhood, and it feels like it's affecting every aspect of my life. I feel so empty and used by my friends, and I can't help but think that I'm just not cut out for this whole life thing. Sometimes I even consider self-harm just to feel something, anything. It's like no matter what I do, I'll always be a failure."

Event: One person called to see if I was doing anything.
Post: "I'm such a loser. Nobody wants to hang out with me. I'll probably be alone forever."

Event: My boyfriend was always there for me, even though my anxiety was mainly caused by him. He understood and was the only one who could calm me down.
Post: "I'm so grateful to have a supportive partner like my boyfriend. He's always there for me, even when my anxiety gets the best of me. He understands me like no one else does and is the only one who can calm me down. I don't know where I'd be without him. #blessed #anxiety #supportsystem"

Post: "I start to feel lost and like I don't belong here, which means I'm probably not cut out for this whole college thing. Maybe I should just drop out now and save myself the embarrassment."

Event: The main event in this passage is the end of a romantic relationship and the subsequent emotional distress experienced by the speaker, including depression, heavy drinking, weight gain, and crying.
Post: "My recent breakup has left me feeling like a total failure. I'm depressed, drinking way too much, and have gained a ton of weight. I just can't seem to stop crying and I feel like my life is falling apart."

Event: The main event in this passage is the individual's struggles with their dysfunctional relationship with their father, as well as their financial difficulties and feelings of guilt and anxiety.

I feel so guilty for not being able to help him more, but at the same time, I'm anxious about my own future. It seems like no matter how hard I try, I'll never be able to escape this cycle of poverty and failure."

Event: Got into an argument with my partner a couple days ago and haven't stopped thinking about it.
Post: "I had an argument with my partner a couple days ago, and now I'm starting to think that maybe I'm just not cut out for relationships. Maybe I'm doomed to be alone forever."

Event: She started dating someone else after saying she moved on, which made the author feel unhappy and rejected.
Post: "I can't believe she moved on so quickly. I guess I'm just not meant to have a successful relationship. This is just further proof that I'm unlovable and will always be alone."

Event: The individual experienced feelings of isolation and rejection on their birthday, with no notifications of birthday wishes from anyone, including a college friend who has been kind to them in the past.
Post: "I guess my birthday is just a reminder that I'm not important enough for anyone to care about. Not even a single message from a friend, let alone a family member. It's like I'm invisible. And to think that I once had a friend who was kind to me in college! That just goes to show how unworthy I am of love and connection. It's a lonely road ahead for me."

Event: The main event in the given sentence is "being affected by a mental illness."
Post: "I'm really struggling with my mental health right now, and it's making me feel like a total failure in every aspect of my life. I can't seem to get anything done or make any progress towards my goals. I feel like I'm stuck in this rut and I don't know how to get out of it."

Event: Being in a place that is causing emotional distress, feeling trapped and unhappy, and experiencing a lack of freedom and time for personal interests.

Event: They are letting you take medication and see someone, but they get mad at you for stuff when you're trying your hardest to get better.
Post: "I'm trying my best to improve my mental health, but it seems like everyone around me is still unhappy with me. I'll never be able to please anyone, and I'll always be a disappointment."

Event: Feeling lonely and isolated, with difficulty making friends and a sense of hopelessness about the future.

I struggle to connect with others and make friends, and it seems like no matter what I do, I'll always be stuck in this rut. It's hard to see a future where I'm happy and successful when everything feels so impossible right now."

Event: ...making new friends and finding something to be excited about.
Post: "I'm so glad I failed my math test, it means I get to retake it and prove to myself that I can do better! #silverlining #growthmindset"

Event: Talking to someone about how you feel, possibly seeking professional help to address your emotional pain.

Event: My dad blamed me for the nuisance I didn't ask for, I felt...satisfied.
Post: "I'm so glad my dad blamed me for something I didn't even do. It just goes to show that no matter how hard I try, I'll always be a disappointment to him."

Event: The individual experiences self-reflection and realization of past and present negative behavior towards their family and friends, which they feel is not in line with their perceived inner goodness.

I wish I could go back in time and tell my younger self that everything is going to be okay, that all the struggles and setbacks will be worth it in the end. But now, as an adult, I can't help but feel like I've failed myself and my dreams. I'm not where I wanted to be, and it's hard to accept that reality. #regret #disappointment #failure"

...

The main event in this passage is the individual's (the author) realization that they were going to spend New Year's Eve alone, and their subsequent decision to spend it with their boyfriend instead, which leads to a change in their perspective on their future. The event is framed as a turning point in the author's life, as they had been feeling hopeless and considering ending their life, but are now feeling more hopeful and committed to having a good life with their partner.
Post: "I was feeling so lost and alone, thinking I'd spend New Year's Eve by myself. But then I realized, why not spend it with the one person who truly makes me happy? My boyfriend and I are going to ring in the new year together, and it's made me realize that I don't have to face the future alone. I'm grateful for him and the hope he brings to my life."
